citation.article-title: The Sulfolobus Caldariella group: taxonomy on the basis of the structure of DNA-dependent RNA polymerases

p.s: Description of Sulfolobus brierleyi sp. nov.
Sulfolobus brierleyi (brier'ley.i. M. L. gen.n.brierleyi of Brierley; named for J. Brierley, the American bacteriologist who isolated this organism)
Cells spherical, irregular polyhedrons, rounded edges, 1-1.5μm (Brierley and Brierley, 1973).
Packed cells have an ochre colour.
Elemental sulfur, ferrous iron, and yeast extract can be used as energy source (Brierley and Brierley, 1973).
Celt wall devoid of peptidogtycan, but composed of protein subunits arranged in hexagonal dense packing.
The G+C content of the DNA is 31 moles % (melting point) resp. 37 moles % (buoyant density).
DNA-dependent RNA polymerase consists of 9 subunits with different molecular weights (Table 3).
Incomplete immunochemical crossreaction with antibody against RNA polymerase from Sulfolobus acidocaldarius (Fig. 5b).
Growth between 45 and 75°C (Brierley and Brierley, 1973), optimum at 70°C at pH 1.5-2.
Isolated from an acidic thermal spring.
